git_blob.name: git_blob
comment: In-memory representation of a blob object.

git_blob_lookup.name: git_blob_lookup

returns.comment: 0 on success; error code otherwise

params.name: blob
params.comment: pointer to the looked up blob

params.name: repo
params.comment: the repo to use when locating the blob.

params.name: id
params.comment: identity of the blob to locate.

comment:
Lookup a blob object from a repository.
 The generated blob object is owned by the revision
 repo and shall not be freed by the user.

git_blob_new.name: git_blob_new

returns.comment: 0 on success; error code otherwise

params.name: repo
params.comment: The repository where the object will reside

comment: Create a new in-memory git_blob.

The blob object must be manually filled using
 the 'set_rawcontent' methods before it can
 be written back to disk.

git_blob_set_rawcontent_fromfile.name: git_blob_set_rawcontent_fromfile

returns.comment: 0 on success; error code otherwise

params.name: filename
params.comment: name of the file to read

comment:
Fill a blob with the contents inside
 the pointed file.

git_blob_set_rawcontent.name: git_blob_set_rawcontent

returns.comment: 0 on success; error code otherwise

params.name: buffer
params.comment: buffer with the contents for the blob

comment:
Fill a blob with the contents inside
 the pointed buffer

git_blob_rawcontent.name: git_blob_rawcontent

returns.comment: the pointer; NULL if the blob has no contents

comment: Get a read-only buffer with the raw content of a blob.

A pointer to the raw content of a blob is returned;
 this pointer is owned internally by the object and shall
 not be free'd. The pointer may be invalidated at a later
 time (e.g. when changing the contents of the blob).

git_blob_rawsize.name: git_blob_rawsize

returns.comment: size on bytes

comment: Get the size in bytes of the contents of a blob

git_blob_writefile.name: git_blob_writefile

params.name: written_id
params.comment: return the id of the written blob

params.name: repo
params.comment: repository where the blob will be written

params.name: path
params.comment: file from which the blob will be created

comment:
Read a file from the working folder of a repository
 and write it to the Object Database as a loose blob,
 if such doesn't exist yet.

info.summary: Git blob load and write routines

git_commit.name: git_commit
comment: Parsed representation of a commit object.

git_commit_lookup.name: git_commit_lookup

returns.comment: 0 on success; error code otherwise

params.name: commit
params.comment: pointer to the looked up commit

params.name: repo
params.comment: the repo to use when locating the commit.

params.name: id
params.comment:
identity of the commit to locate.  If the object is
        an annotated tag it will be peeled back to the commit.

comment:
Lookup a commit object from a repository.
 The generated commit object is owned by the revision
 repo and shall not be freed by the user.

git_commit_new.name: git_commit_new

returns.comment: 0 on success; error code otherwise

params.name: repo
params.comment: The repository where the object will reside

comment: Create a new in-memory git_commit.

The commit object must be manually filled using
 setter methods before it can be written to its
 repository.

git_commit_id.name: git_commit_id

returns.comment: object identity for the commit.

comment: Get the id of a commit.

git_commit_message_short.name: git_commit_message_short

returns.comment: the short message of a commit

comment: Get the short (one line) message of a commit.

git_commit_message.name: git_commit_message

returns.comment: the message of a commit

comment: Get the full message of a commit.

git_commit_time.name: git_commit_time

returns.comment: the time of a commit

comment: Get the commit time (i.e. committer time) of a commit.

git_commit_committer.name: git_commit_committer

returns.comment: the committer of a commit

comment: Get the committer of a commit.

git_commit_author.name: git_commit_author

returns.comment: the author of a commit

comment: Get the author of a commit.

git_commit_tree.name: git_commit_tree

returns.comment: the tree of a commit

comment: Get the tree pointed to by a commit.

git_commit_add_parent.name: git_commit_add_parent

params.name: new_parent
params.comment: the new commit which will be a parent

comment: Add a new parent commit to an existing commit

git_commit_set_message.name: git_commit_set_message
comment: Set the message of a commit

git_commit_set_committer.name: git_commit_set_committer

params.name: time
params.comment: time when the committer committed the commit

comment: Set the committer of a commit

git_commit_set_author.name: git_commit_set_author

params.name: time
params.comment: time when the author created the commit

comment: Set the author of a commit

git_commit_set_tree.name: git_commit_set_tree
comment: Set the tree which is pointed to by a commit

GIT_EXTERN(type).name: GIT_EXTERN(type)
GIT_EXTERN(type).comment: Declare a public function exported for application use.

GIT_EXTERN_TLS(type).name: GIT_EXTERN_TLS(type)
GIT_EXTERN_TLS(type).comment: Declare a public TLS symbol exported for application use.

GIT_INLINE(type).name: GIT_INLINE(type)
GIT_INLINE(type).comment: Declare a function as always inlined.

GIT_FORMAT_PRINTF(a,b).name: GIT_FORMAT_PRINTF(a,b)
GIT_FORMAT_PRINTF(a,b).comment: Declare a function's takes printf style arguments.

GIT_ERROR.name: GIT_ERROR
GIT_ERROR.comment: Operation failed, with unspecified reason. This value also serves as the base error code; all other error codes are subtracted from it such that all errors are < 0, in typical POSIX C tradition.

GIT_ENOTOID.name: GIT_ENOTOID
GIT_ENOTOID.comment: Input was not a properly formatted Git object id.

GIT_ENOTFOUND.name: GIT_ENOTFOUND
GIT_ENOTFOUND.comment: Input does not exist in the scope searched.

GIT_EOBJTYPE.name: GIT_EOBJTYPE
GIT_EOBJTYPE.comment: The specified object is of invalid type

GIT_EOBJCORRUPTED.name: GIT_EOBJCORRUPTED
GIT_EOBJCORRUPTED.comment: The specified object has its data corrupted

GIT_EINVALIDTYPE.name: GIT_EINVALIDTYPE
GIT_EINVALIDTYPE.comment: The object type is invalid or doesn't match

GIT_EMISSINGOBJDATA.name: GIT_EMISSINGOBJDATA
GIT_EMISSINGOBJDATA.comment: The object cannot be written that because it's missing internal data

GIT_EPACKCORRUPTED.name: GIT_EPACKCORRUPTED
GIT_EPACKCORRUPTED.comment: The packfile for the ODB is corrupted

GIT_EFLOCKFAIL.name: GIT_EFLOCKFAIL
GIT_EFLOCKFAIL.comment: Failed to adquire or release a file lock

GIT_EZLIB.name: GIT_EZLIB
GIT_EZLIB.comment: The Z library failed to inflate/deflate an object's data

GIT_EBUSY.name: GIT_EBUSY
GIT_EBUSY.comment: The queried object is currently busy

GIT_EBAREINDEX.name: GIT_EBAREINDEX
GIT_EBAREINDEX.comment: The index file is not backed up by an existing repository

git_repository.name: git_repository
comment:
Representation of an existing git repository,
 including all its object contents

git_object.name: git_object
comment: Representation of a generic object in a repository

git_person.name: git_person
comment: Parsed representation of a person

git_strerror.name: git_strerror

returns.comment: a string explaining the error code

comment: strerror() for the Git library

info.summary: Git error handling routines and variables

git_index.name: git_index
comment: Memory representation of an index file.

git_index_time.name: git_index_time
comment: Time used in a git index entry

git_index_entry.name: git_index_entry
comment: Memory representation of a file entry in the index.

git_index_open_bare.name: git_index_open_bare

returns.comment: 0 on success; error code otherwise

params.name: index
params.comment: the pointer for the new index

params.name: index_path
params.comment: the path to the index file in disk

comment:
Create a new Git index object as a memory representation
 of the Git index file in 'index_path', without a repository
 to back it.

Since there is no ODB behind this index, any Index methods
 which rely on the ODB (e.g. index_add) will fail with the
 GIT_EBAREINDEX error code.

git_index_open_inrepo.name: git_index_open_inrepo

returns.comment: 0 on success; error code otherwise

params.name: repo
params.comment: the git repo which owns the index

comment:
Open the Index inside the git repository pointed
 by 'repo'.

git_index_clear.name: git_index_clear
comment:
Clear the contents (all the entries) of an index object.
 This clears the index object in memory; changes must be manually
 written to disk for them to take effect.

git_index_free.name: git_index_free
comment: Free an existing index object.

git_index_read.name: git_index_read

returns.comment: 0 on success, otherwise an error code

comment:
Update the contents of an existing index object in memory
 by reading from the hard disk.

git_index_write.name: git_index_write

returns.comment: 0 on success, otherwise an error code

comment:
Write an existing index object from memory back to disk
 using an atomic file lock.

git_index_find.name: git_index_find

returns.comment: an index >= 0 if found, -1 otherwise

comment:
Find the first index of any entires which point to given
 path in the Git index.

git_index_add.name: git_index_add

returns.comment: 0 on success, otherwise an error code

comment: Add or update an index entry from a file in disk.

git_index_remove.name: git_index_remove

returns.comment: 0 on success, otherwise an error code

params.name: position
params.comment: position of the entry to remove

comment: Remove an entry from the index

git_index_insert.name: git_index_insert

returns.comment: 0 on success, otherwise an error code

comment:
Insert an entry into the index.
 A full copy (including the 'path' string) of the given
 'source_entry' will be inserted on the index; if the index
 already contains an entry for the same path, the entry
 will be updated.

git_index_get.name: git_index_get

returns.comment: a pointer to the entry; NULL if out of bounds

comment: Get a pointer to one of the entries in the index

This entry can be modified, and the changes will be written
 back to disk on the next write() call.

git_index_entrycount.name: git_index_entrycount

returns.comment: integer of count of current entries

comment: Get the count of entries currently in the index

info.summary: Git index parsing and manipulation routines

git_odb.name: git_odb
comment: An open object database handle.

git_odb_open.name: git_odb_open

returns.comment:
GIT_SUCCESS if the database opened; otherwise an error
         code describing why the open was not possible.

params.name: out
params.comment:
location to store the database pointer, if opened.
            Set to NULL if the open failed.

comment: Open an object database for read/write access.

git_odb_close.name: git_odb_close

params.name: db
params.comment: database pointer to close.  If NULL no action is taken.

comment: Close an open object database.

git_otype.name: git_otype

members.name: GIT_OBJ_ANY
comment: Object can be any of the following

members.name: GIT_OBJ_BAD
comment: Object is invalid.

members.name: GIT_OBJ__EXT1
comment: Reserved for future use.

members.name: GIT_OBJ_COMMIT
comment: A commit object.

members.name: GIT_OBJ_TREE
comment: A tree (directory listing) object.

members.name: GIT_OBJ_BLOB
comment: A file revision object.

members.name: GIT_OBJ_TAG
comment: An annotated tag object.

members.name: GIT_OBJ__EXT2
comment: Reserved for future use.

members.name: GIT_OBJ_OFS_DELTA
comment: A delta, base is given by an offset.

members.name: GIT_OBJ_REF_DELTA
comment: A delta, base is given by object id.
Basic type (loose or packed) of any Git object.

git_rawobj.name: git_rawobj
comment: An object read from the database.

members.name: data
comment: Raw, decompressed object data.

members.name: len
comment: Total number of bytes in data.

members.name: type
comment: Type of this object.

git_odb_read.name: git_odb_read

returns.comment:
- GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read;
 - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.

params.name: out
params.comment: object descriptor to populate upon reading.

params.name: db
params.comment: database to search for the object in.

params.name: id
params.comment: identity of the object to read.

comment: Read an object from the database.
If GIT_ENOTFOUND then out->data is set to NULL.

git_odb_read_header.name: git_odb_read_header

returns.comment:
- GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read;
 - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.

params.name: out
params.comment: object descriptor to populate upon reading.

params.name: db
params.comment: database to search for the object in.

params.name: id
params.comment: identity of the object to read.

comment:
Read the header of an object from the database, without
 reading its full contents.

Only the 'type' and 'len' fields of the git_rawobj structure
 are filled. The 'data' pointer will always be NULL.

The raw object pointed by 'out' doesn't need to be manually
 closed with git_obj_close().

git_odb__read_packed.name: git_odb__read_packed

returns.comment:
- GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read.
 - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.

params.name: out
params.comment: object descriptor to populate upon reading.

params.name: db
params.comment: database to search for the object in.

params.name: id
params.comment: identity of the object to read.

comment: Read an object from the database using only pack files.
If GIT_ENOTFOUND then out->data is set to NULL.

git_odb__read_loose.name: git_odb__read_loose

returns.comment:
- GIT_SUCCESS if the object was read.
 - GIT_ENOTFOUND if the object is not in the database.

params.name: out
params.comment: object descriptor to populate upon reading.

params.name: db
params.comment: database to search for the object in.

params.name: id
params.comment: identity of the object to read.

comment: Read an object from the database using only loose object files.
If GIT_ENOTFOUND then out->data is set to NULL.

git_odb_write.name: git_odb_write

returns.comment:
- GIT_SUCCESS if the object was written;
 - GIT_ERROR otherwise.

params.name: db
params.comment: database to which the object should be written.

params.name: obj
params.comment: object descriptor for the object to write.

comment: Write an object to the database.

git_obj_close.name: git_obj_close
comment: Release all memory used by the obj structure.
As a result of this call, obj->data will be set to NULL.
If obj->data is already NULL, nothing happens.

git_obj_type_to_string.name: git_obj_type_to_string

returns.comment: the corresponding string representation.

comment: Convert an object type to it's string representation.

The result is a pointer to a string in static memory and
 should not be free()'ed.

git_obj_string_to_type.name: git_obj_string_to_type

returns.comment: the corresponding git_otype.

comment: Convert a string object type representation to it's git_otype.

git_obj__loose_object_type.name: git_obj__loose_object_type

returns.comment:
true if the type represents a valid loose object type,
 false otherwise.

comment: Determine if the given git_otype is a valid loose object type.

git_obj_hash.name: git_obj_hash

returns.comment:
- GIT_SUCCESS if the object-ID was correctly determined.
 - GIT_ERROR if the given object is malformed.

params.name: obj
params.comment: the object whose hash is to be determined.

comment: Determine the object-ID (sha1 hash) of the given git_rawobj.

The input obj must be a valid loose object type and the data
 pointer must not be NULL, unless the len field is also zero.

git_odb_exists.name: git_odb_exists

returns.comment:
- true, if the object was found
 - false, otherwise

params.name: db
params.comment: database to be searched for the given object.

comment: Determine if the given object can be found in the object database.

GIT_OID_RAWSZ.name: GIT_OID_RAWSZ
GIT_OID_RAWSZ.comment: Size (in bytes) of a raw/binary oid

GIT_OID_HEXSZ.name: GIT_OID_HEXSZ
GIT_OID_HEXSZ.comment: Size (in bytes) of a hex formatted oid

git_oid.name: git_oid
comment: Unique identity of any object (commit, tree, blob, tag).

members.name: id
comment: raw binary formatted id

git_oid_mkstr.name: git_oid_mkstr

returns.comment: GIT_SUCCESS if valid; GIT_ENOTOID on failure.

params.name: out
params.comment: oid structure the result is written into.

params.name: str
params.comment:
input hex string; must be pointing at the start of
        the hex sequence and have at least the number of bytes
        needed for an oid encoded in hex (40 bytes).

comment: Parse a hex formatted object id into a git_oid.

git_oid_mkraw.name: git_oid_mkraw

params.name: out
params.comment: oid structure the result is written into.

params.name: raw
params.comment: the raw input bytes to be copied.

comment: Copy an already raw oid into a git_oid structure.

git_repository_open.name: git_repository_open

returns.comment: the new repository handle; NULL on error

params.name: repository
params.comment: pointer to the repo which will be opened

comment: Open a git repository.

The 'path' argument must point to an existing git repository
 folder, e.g.

/path/to/my_repo/.git/	(normal repository)
							objects/
							index
							HEAD

/path/to/bare_repo/		(bare repository)
						objects/
						index
						HEAD

The method will automatically detect if 'path' is a normal
	or bare repository or fail is 'path' is neither.

git_repository_lookup.name: git_repository_lookup

returns.comment: a reference to the object

params.name: repo
params.comment: the repository to look up the object

params.name: id
params.comment: the unique identifier for the object

comment: Lookup a reference to one of the objects in the repostory.

The generated reference is owned by the repository and
 should not be freed by the user.

The 'type' parameter must match the type of the object
 in the odb; the method will fail otherwise.
 The special value 'GIT_OBJ_ANY' may be passed to let
 the method guess the object's type.

git_repository_database.name: git_repository_database

returns.comment: a pointer to the object db

comment: Get the object database behind a Git repository

git_repository_index.name: git_repository_index

returns.comment:
a pointer to the Index object; 
	NULL if the index cannot be opened

comment: Get the Index file of a Git repository

git_repository_newobject.name: git_repository_newobject

returns.comment: the new object

params.name: type
params.comment: Type of the object to be created

comment:
Create a new in-memory repository object with
 the given type.

The object's attributes can be filled in using the
 corresponding setter methods.

The object will be written back to given git_repository
 when the git_object_write() function is called; objects
 cannot be written to disk until all their main
 attributes have been properly filled.

Objects are instantiated with no SHA1 id; their id
 will be automatically generated when writing to the
 repository.

git_object_write.name: git_object_write

returns.comment: 0 on success; otherwise an error code

comment: Write back an object to disk.

The object will be written to its corresponding
 repository.

If the object has no changes since it was first
 read from the repository, no actions will take place.

If the object has been modified since it was read from
 the repository, or it has been created from scratch
 in memory, it will be written to the repository and
 its SHA1 ID will be updated accordingly.

git_object_id.name: git_object_id

returns.comment: the SHA1 id

comment: Get the id (SHA1) of a repository object

In-memory objects created by git_object_new() do not
 have a SHA1 ID until they are written on a repository.

git_object_type.name: git_object_type

returns.comment: the object's type

comment: Get the object type of an object

git_object_owner.name: git_object_owner

returns.comment: the repository who owns this object

comment: Get the repository that owns this object

git_object_free.name: git_object_free
comment: Free a reference to one of the objects in the repository.

Repository objects are managed automatically by the library,
 but this method can be used to force freeing one of the
 objects.

Careful: freeing objects in the middle of a repository
 traversal will most likely cause errors.

git_repository_free.name: git_repository_free

params.name: repo
params.comment: repository handle to close. If NULL nothing occurs.

comment: Free a previously allocated repository

GIT_SORT_NONE.name: GIT_SORT_NONE
GIT_SORT_NONE.comment: Sort the repository contents in no particular ordering; this sorting is arbitrary, implementation-specific and subject to change at any time. This is the default sorting for new walkers.

GIT_SORT_TOPOLOGICAL.name: GIT_SORT_TOPOLOGICAL
GIT_SORT_TOPOLOGICAL.comment: Sort the repository contents in topological order (parents before children); this sorting mode can be combined with time sorting.

GIT_SORT_TIME.name: GIT_SORT_TIME
GIT_SORT_TIME.comment: Sort the repository contents by commit time; this sorting mode can be combined with topological sorting.

GIT_SORT_REVERSE.name: GIT_SORT_REVERSE
GIT_SORT_REVERSE.comment: Iterate through the repository contents in reverse order; this sorting mode can be combined with any of the above.

git_revwalk_new.name: git_revwalk_new

returns.comment: 0 on success; error code otherwise

params.name: walker
params.comment: pointer to the new revision walker

comment: Allocate a new revision walker to iterate through a repo.

git_revwalk_reset.name: git_revwalk_reset
comment: Reset the walking machinery for reuse.

git_revwalk_push.name: git_revwalk_push
comment:
Mark a commit to start traversal from.
 The commit object must belong to the repo which is being walked through.

git_revwalk_hide.name: git_revwalk_hide

params.name: commit
params.comment: the commit that will be ignored during the traversal

comment: Mark a commit (and its ancestors) uninteresting for the output.

git_revwalk_next.name: git_revwalk_next

returns.comment: next commit; NULL if there is no more output.

params.name: walk
params.comment: the walker to pop the commit from.

comment: Get the next commit from the revision traversal.

git_revwalk_sorting.name: git_revwalk_sorting

params.name: walk
params.comment: the walker being used for the traversal.

comment:
Change the sorting mode when iterating through the
 repository's contents.
 Changing the sorting mode resets the walker.

git_revwalk_free.name: git_revwalk_free

params.name: walk
params.comment: traversal handle to close.  If NULL nothing occurs.

comment: Free a revwalk previously allocated.

git_revwalk_repository.name: git_revwalk_repository

returns.comment: the repository being walked

comment:
Return the repository on which this walker
 is operating.
